smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain elements and are not empty.

All use cases are associated with an actor, either directly (e.g., 'Koosta arhetüüp' to 'Tehnik') or indirectly via <<include>> relationships from use cases that are connected to actors (e.g., 'Vaata kinnitamata arhetüüpe' is included by 'Koosta arhetüüp').
No use cases with redundant names describing the same activity were found.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.
No redundant data columns lacking Foreign Keys were identified in the data models.
Use case naming is consistent, using the 'Verb + Noun' format (e.g., 'Koosta arhetüüp', 'Tuvasta kasutaja').
All states in the state diagram (Page 7) are reachable via transitions from the start state or other reachable states.
All actions in the activity diagrams (Pages 3 and 4) are reachable through the defined flows and decisions.
All relationships in the class and conceptual diagrams display multiplicity indicators at both ends (e.g., 1..0..*).
The Use Case diagram 'Arhetüüpide funktsionaalne allsüsteem' on Page 2 contains exactly 10 central elements (use cases), which meets the threshold of 10 or more central elements.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines. The maximum found is 5 (for the 'Arhetüüp' class/table).
The layout of the diagrams is reasonably compact, with no elements placed at an excessive distance (more than twice the average) from their related elements.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Koosta', 'Vaatab', 'Otsib').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less. (Note: 'Isik' is 4 characters).
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Arhetüüp', 'Hoone').
All attribute/column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'nimetus', 'kood').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like 'tbl_', 'str') were found in class, table, or attribute names.
